IO

Class IORunSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • IO.IORunSet

  • public class IORunSet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages RunSet input/output operation and RunSet creation from all .res files contained into a single Directory placed at path in IOManager.DefaultInPath.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.io.File[] _files
      This field contains all files of the current Runset directory.
      (package private) java.lang.String _testName
      is the RunSet name that corresponds to input directory name.
      (package private) static java.lang.String normPrefix
      Prefix for output folder that contain normalized input runs.
      (package private) static java.lang.String outFileExtension
      Default extention for output Run files

      IORunSet(java.io.File[] files, java.lang.String dirName)

    • Field Detail

      • _files

        java.io.File[] _files
        This field contains all files of the current Runset directory. Each file is a single Run of current Runset.

      • _testName

        java.lang.String _testName
        is the RunSet name that corresponds to input directory name. The input directory is the directory that contains all runs of current RunSet.

      • normPrefix

        static final java.lang.String normPrefix
        Prefix for output folder that contain normalized input runs.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • outFileExtension

        static final java.lang.String outFileExtension
        Default extention for output Run files
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • IORunSet

        public IORunSet(java.io.File[] files,
                java.lang.String dirName)

    • Method Detail

      • getInDir

        java.lang.String getInDir()
        Returns:
        the input directory path string.

      • getOutDir

        public static java.lang.String getOutDir(java.lang.String dirName)
        Parameters:
        dirName - is the RunSet's name. RunSet fusion output files produced from this RunSet are saved into a folder in IOManager.DefaultOutPath that have the same name of the Runset.
        Returns:
        The path string to the output directory for fusion results.

      • getFileNames

        java.io.File[] getFileNames()

      • deserialize

        public RunSet deserialize()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Perform RunSet deserialization using _testName to identify the correct directory to write output in IOManager.DefaultOutPath.
        Returns:
        The deserialized RunSet
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case of error in file reading operation.

      • serialize

        public static void serialize(RunSet runSet)
                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                             java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Perform RunSet serialization. A RunSet serialization create a folder (if missing) in IOManager.DefaultOutPath.
        Parameters:
        runSet - RunSet we want to serialize.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - for error in file writing process
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - File writing error

      • serializeAsNormlized

        public static void serializeAsNormlized(RunSet runSet)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Write to file RunSet once normalization has been performed. Normalized RunSet serialization does not overwrite input RunSet files.
        Parameters:
        runSet - The normalized RunSet we want to serialized.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Output file/directory not found
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - File writing error

      • setExtension

        private static java.lang.String setExtension(java.lang.String fileName)
        Setting file output extension. Output file extension is decided in parameter
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of file we want to add extension string
        Returns:
        the filename extension with default extension added.
        See Also:
        outFileExtension
